page.title: 07WOODHILL HOUSE
page.content: Woodhill House which is situated between Ashgrove Road West and Westburn Road is the Administrative HQ of Grampian Regional Council. It is modern building, completed in 1975 when local government was reformed. The offices are of an open plan nature and are contained in the three floors of the main building. Access is by elevator or stairs.To the East of the main building are the various committee rooms. It is here that the elected Regional councillors meet, both in full council as well as committees. Since Regionalisation, the Conservative Party has held power, though their majority over the other parties is gradually being reduced. The present convenor of the Council is John Sorrie a well known poultry farmer from Inverurie.
